message_1:
A student wants to evaluate the following propositional expression:

(p AND q) OR (NOT p)

If p is false and q is true, what is the truth value of the expression?
message_2:
To evaluate the expression, we will substitute the given values of p and q into the expression and then simplify it step by step.

Given: p is false and q is true.

Expression: (p AND q) OR (NOT p)

Step 1: Substitute the values of p and q.
= (false AND true) OR (NOT false)

Step 2: Evaluate the AND operation.
= (false) OR (NOT false)

Step 3: Evaluate the NOT operation.
= (false) OR (true)

Step 4: Evaluate the OR operation.
= true

So, the truth value of the expression is true.
